meanings.definition: To perform better or achieve more than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: She was overachieving in her studies, always getting top grades.
meanings.sent2: The team was overachieving this season, winning every game so far.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was overachieving in gathering nuts, storing more than it needed for winter.
meanings.sent4: The sun was overachieving in its brightness, making everything seem extra vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The student was overachieving in the science fair, creating an impressive project that amazed everyone.

meanings.definition: Someone who achieves more than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: He was known as an overachieving student, always excelling in every subject.
meanings.sent2: The overachieving employee received a promotion for consistently exceeding goals.
meanings.sent3: The overachieving cat caught more mice than the entire neighborhood combined.
meanings.sent4: The overachieving flower bloomed earlier and more beautifully than all the others in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The overachieving athlete broke multiple records in a single season, surprising everyone with their talent.
